newsitem.title: USA: Motorola wins $100 mln Philippine contract.
newsitem.headline: Motorola wins $100 mln Philippine contract.

text.p: Motorola Inc said on Tuesday that its Asia Pacific Cellular Infrastructure Group has signed a contract worth more than $100 million to install a fixed wireless telephone network in the southern and western Mindanao regions of the Philippines .
The contract is part of a build and transfer arrangement between the Pilipino Telephone Corp (Piltel) and Marubeni Corp of Japan.
The Motorola network will fulfil part of Piltel's commitment to provide 400,000 additional telephone lines in southern regions of the Philippines.
The network will provide service for residential and business subscribers in cities such as Davao, General Santos, Pagadian, Zamboanga and Dipolog.
Installation will begin during the fourth quarter of 1996 with commercial service scheduled to begin during the second quarter of 1997, Motorola said.
Marubeni, as the prime contractor, has responsibility for building the network for Piltel, which will then operate it.
In 1995, Piltel had awarded Motorola a $270 million contract to expand and enhance its Mobiline cellular phone system in the Manila area. Mobiline is Piltel's national cellular phone system.
Piltel, which has been a conventional telephone provider since 1968, also operates a nationwide paging system, and other wireless services throughout the Philippines.
Marubeni is one of Japan's largest general trading houses, comprised of eight business groups and 21 divisions. --Chicago newsdesk 312 408 8787
